description: This represents the objects used for Settings and SettingsResults in the Redfish specification.
specification: This schema shall be used to represent the properties used for Settings and SettingsResults.  All values for resources described by this schema shall comply to the requirements as described in the Redfish specification at <url>.  Copyright (c) 2013, Avocent & Hewlett-Packard.  All rights reserved.

href.description: Reference to the resource the client may PUT/PATCH to in order to change this resource.
href.specification: The value of this property shall be the URI of the resource to which a client must do a PUT or PATCh in order to modify this resource.

Settings.description: Reference to separate pending settings resource from this current resource.

Operation.specification: The value of this property shall indicate the results of the settings application.  The value SettingsApply shall be used to indicate the Settings were applied during the normal course of operations, such as what happens during a reboot.

Time.description: Indicates the time the settings were applied.
Time.specification: The value of this property shall indicate the time that the settings object was applied to the resource.

ETag.description: The ETag of the resource to which the settings were applied, after the application.
ETag.specification: The value of this property shall be the ETag of the resource to which the settings were applied, after the application.  This is here so that the client can check it against the ETag of the current resource to see if any other changes have also happened to the resource.

MessageID.description: This is the key for this message which can be used to look up the message in a message registry.
MessageID.specification: This property shall be a key into message registry as described in the Redfish specification.

MessageArgs.description: This array of message arguments are substituted for the arguments in the message when looked up in the message registry.
MessageArgs.specification: This property shall contain the message substitution arguments for the specific message referenced by the MessageID and shall only be included if the MessageID is present.

Message.description: This is the human readable message, if provided.
Message.specification: This property shall contain an optional human readable message.

PropertiesInError.description: This is an array of properties in the request body that caused the errors.
PropertiesInError.specification: This property shall contain an array of property names in error, if appropriate for the message.

enumDescriptions.Warning: A condition exists that requires attention
enumDescriptions.Critical: A critical condition exists that requires immediate attention

Severity.description: This is the severity of the errors.
Severity.specification: The value of this property shall be the severity of the error, as defined in the Status section of the Redfish specificaiton.

Resolution.description: Used to provide suggestions on how to resolve the situation that caused the error.
Resolution.specification: This property shall contain an override of the Resolution of the message in message registry, if present.
